il.ac.technion.nlp.nli.parser.experiment

Class ExperimentSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • il.ac.technion.nlp.nli.parser.experiment.ExperimentSettings
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ExperimentSettings
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Defines the exact settings in which an experiment run. To be sent (serialized) to remote hosts which will run the experiment and send back the results. All the path fields, unless specified otherwise, are either absolute or relative to the resource directory of this module.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • tagNameToValue

        public final ofergivoli.olib.data_structures.map.SafeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> tagNameToValue
        Tags contain information about the experiment that isn't used when executing the experiment.

      • deterministic

        public final boolean deterministic
        The execution of the experiment should be deterministic (might slightly increase execution time).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • testDomainId

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String testDomainId
        Should not be null in in-domain and zero-shot setups. May be null in any other setup (e.g. training on all training data without evaluation).

      • setupType

        public ExperimentSettings.SetupType setupType

      • trainingExampleIds

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> trainingExampleIds
        Actual train examples to be used. For 2-step training experiments, the split of these examples over the two steps is defined by firstStepTrainingDomainIds. Implementation note: We don't want to reference the examples themselves because we want to keep the serialized representation of this object small (so it could be quickly transferred to remote hosts).

      • testExampleIds

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> testExampleIds
        Actual test examples to be used.

      • iterationsNum

        public int iterationsNum
        The number of train-test iteration to perform. The test/dev set is tested after each training iteration (and is reported as part of that iteration's results). For 2-step training experiments, this defines the iterations number of the second step. For evaluation-only setup this should be 1.

      • shuffleTrainingExamplesBetweenIterations

        public boolean shuffleTrainingExamplesBetweenIterations

      • regularizationCoefficient

        public double regularizationCoefficient

      • initStepSize

        public double initStepSize
        Corresponds to Params.Options#initStepSize.

      • lazyL1FullUpdateFreq

        public int lazyL1FullUpdateFreq
        Corresponds to Params.Options#lazyL1FullUpdateFreq, except that -1 means using non-lazy regularization.

      • beamSize

        public int beamSize
        Max number of derivations to keep in a cell during inference.

      • maxNgramLengthForLexicalizedPhrasePredicateFeatures

        public int maxNgramLengthForLexicalizedPhrasePredicateFeatures
        The value for PhrasePredicateFeatureComputer.Options#maxNforLexicalizeAllPairs.

      • maxDerivationSize

        public int maxDerivationSize
        The value for FloatingParser.Options#maxDepth

      • testOnTrainSetAfterAllIterations

        public boolean testOnTrainSetAfterAllIterations
        when true, after all training iterations are done we test on the training set without modifying the weifghts (i.e. with the same weights used for testing on the test set in the last iteration).

      • useAppLogicFiltering

        public boolean useAppLogicFiltering

      • useLexicalizedPhrasePredicateFeatures

        public boolean useLexicalizedPhrasePredicateFeatures

      • extractUnlexicalizedPhrasePredicateFeaturesWithoutPos

        public boolean extractUnlexicalizedPhrasePredicateFeaturesWithoutPos

      • usePredicatesThatAreProbablyDomainSpecificForExtractingLexicalizedPhrasePredicateFeatures

        public boolean usePredicatesThatAreProbablyDomainSpecificForExtractingLexicalizedPhrasePredicateFeatures

      • useDescriptionPhraseFeatures

        public boolean useDescriptionPhraseFeatures

      • enableInstructionFeatures

        public java.lang.Boolean enableInstructionFeatures
        When this is false, we don't use any features beyond those already extracted by Sempre. null is equivalent to true (for backward compatibility).

      • unconditionalWeightUpdateFraction

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double unconditionalWeightUpdateFraction
        This value is in the range (0,1], and it's the potion wight updates that gets carried out regardless of existence of evidence suggesting the update is useful for multiple domains. When null we do full unconditional updates (i.e. as if the value if 1.0).

      • domainsNumberRequiredForCwu

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Integer domainsNumberRequiredForCwu
        CWU = conditional weight update. Should be null only if unconditionalWeightUpdateFraction is null.

      • twoStepTraining

        public boolean twoStepTraining

      • firstStepRegularizationCoefficient

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double firstStepRegularizationCoefficient
        If null and it's a 2-step training experiment, then the value of regularizationCoefficient is used. Should be null when it's not a 2-step training experiment.

      • firstStepInitStepSize

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Double firstStepInitStepSize
        If null and it's a 2-step training experiment, then the value of initStepSize is used. Should be null when it's not a 2-step training experiment.

      • firstStepIterationsNum

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Integer firstStepIterationsNum
        null iff the experiment is not a 2-step training experiment.

      • firstStepTrainingDomainIds

        @Nullable
public java.util.List<java.lang.String> firstStepTrainingDomainIds
        All domains not in this list, and excluding the test domain, will be used as training in the second step. null iff the experiment is not a 2-step training experiment.

      • domainOrdering

        @Nullable
public java.util.List<java.lang.String> domainOrdering
        The domain ordering used to define the partition of domains into first and second steps. null iff the experiment is not a 2-step training experiment.

      • initialWeightsFileAbsoluteOrRelativeToExperimentDir

        @Nullable
public java.io.File initialWeightsFileAbsoluteOrRelativeToExperimentDir
        If not null, the initial weights are read from this file.

      • featuresGeneralityScoresXml

        @Nullable
public java.io.File featuresGeneralityScoresXml
        Can be null if not used. Note: this is not Path because this class needs to be serializable.

      • numOfFeaturesToUpdateWeightsForInStep2

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Integer numOfFeaturesToUpdateWeightsForInStep2
        Must be null in non 2-step experiments. In 2-step experiments, if this is null, then all features get their weights updated in the second step. If not null, the features that get their weights updated are those that have the top generality score, determined by featuresGeneralityScoresXml.

      • featuresAllowedToBeExtractedNum

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Integer featuresAllowedToBeExtractedNum
        When not null, only the this many features are allowed to be extracted (those with highest generality score, even if due to other options they are not in practice extracted). This field can hold a value higher than the total number of features in the feature generality scores file.

      • analysisSettings

        public ExperimentAnalysisSettings analysisSettings

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExperimentSettings

        public ExperimentSettings(il.ac.technion.nlp.nli.core.dataset.ExampleSplit trainTestSplit,
                          @Nullable
                          java.lang.String testDomainId,
                          ExperimentSettings.SetupType setupType,
                          @Nullable
                          java.lang.Integer maxTrainingExamplesNum,
                          @Nullable
                          java.lang.Integer maxTestExamplesNum,
                          int iterationsNum)
        Parameters:
        trainTestSplit - only used during construction (reference not saved).
        maxTrainingExamplesNum - if null then all are used.
        maxTestExamplesNum - if null then all are used.

    • Method Detail

      • getEvaluationOnlyVersion

        public ExperimentSettings getEvaluationOnlyVersion(java.util.List<java.lang.String> idsOfExamplesToEvaluateOn,
                                                   java.nio.file.Path initialWeightsFileForEvaluationAbsoluteOrRelativeToExperimentDir)
        The testExampleIds and initialWeightsFileAbsoluteOrRelativeToExperimentDir fields of this object do not affect the returned value (in which these fields are set according the arguments).
        Parameters:
        idsOfExamplesToEvaluateOn - reference to a shallow copy is kept.
        Returns:
        a clone of this object, set such that only evaluation takes place (no training).

      • deepCopy

        public ExperimentSettings deepCopy()
